item.title: Auditing Changes with Hstore
item.description: In a previous article about Trigger Parameters we have been using the extension hstore in order to compute some extra field in our records, where the fields used both for the computation and for storing the results were passed in as dynamic parameters. Today we’re going to see another trigger use case for hstore: we are going to record changes made to our tuples. Comparing hstores One of the operators that hstore propose is the hstore - hstore operator whose documentation says that it will delete matching pairs from left operand.

item.title: Trigger Parameters
item.description: Sometimes you want to compute values automatically at INSERT time, like for example a duration column out of a start and an end column, both timestamptz. It’s easy enough to do with a BEFORE TRIGGER on your table. What’s more complex is to come up with a parametrized spelling of the trigger, where you can attach the same stored procedure to any table even when the column names are different from one another.
